title: Psalm 140
text:
Psalm 140 is the 140th <a href="psalm">psalm</a> of the <a href="Bible">biblical</a> <a href="Book%20of%20Psalms">Book of Psalms</a>. In the slightly different numbering system in the Greek <a href="Septuagint">Septuagint</a> version of the Bible, and in its Latin translation, the <a href="Vulgate">Vulgate</a>, this psalm is Psalm 139. It describes putting one's trust in God while threatened with evil.

In the <a href="Hebrew%20Bible">Hebrew Bible</a>s, Psalm 140 has 14 verses, because the header of the psalm, ""For the Leader. A Psalm of <a href="David">David</a>"" is numbered as verse 1, whereas in many English Bibles this psalm has 13 verses, because the header ("To the Chief Musician. A Psalm of David" in the <a href="NKJV">NKJV</a>) is not generally given a verse number.
